head.supplied: Botanic Garden, ¶ Melbourne, 22nd Febr. 1872 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit that you will be pleased to sanction the transfer of the sum of Thirty five pounds (£35. -) from the vote for purcha...

div.p: B72/1752, unit 596, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by Georg Luehmann and signed by M. Botanic Garden,

I have the honor to solicit that you will be pleased to sanction the transfer of the sum of Thirty five pounds (£35. -) from the vote for purchase of museum material, plants and seeds, now under authority No. 514, to the vote for stores, to enable me to meet the unavoidable demands for tools, coal, flower pots &c. during the remainder of the current financial year.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be

div.p:
The Honorable the Chief Secretary
An annotation indicates that the transfer was put through on 28 February.
